alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Lucie and central Martin Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 744 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over southern St. Lucie and Martin counties, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart and Indiantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. On rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie
